name: Escort Package
desc:
Increases the ship's maneuverability by %s. Increases the range of all point-defense weapons by %s, and increases the damage dealt to fighters and missiles by %s.

Will try to engage enemies and otherwise act as a combat ship in battle.
short: Increases maneuverability, point-defense range, and damage dealt to fighters and missiles.

name: Stabilized Shields
desc: Reduces the amount of soft flux raised shields generate per second by %s. Does not affect the hard flux generated as a result of shields taking damage.

name: Unstable Injector
desc:
Increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s/%s su/second, depending on hull size.

Interferes with weapons targeting and other vulnerable systems, reducing weapon range by %s and increasing the fighter replacement time by %s.

name: Additional Berthing
desc:
Increases maximum crew capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.

name: Augmented Drive Field
desc: Increases maximum burn level by %s.

name: Auxiliary Fuel Tanks
desc:
Increases maximum fuel capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.

name: Efficiency Overhaul
desc:
Reduces supply use for maintenance, fuel use, and minimum crew required by %s.

Increases the combat readiness recovery and repair rates by %s. The per-day supply consumption for CR recovery is increased to account for the increased recovery rate, but the total supply cost remains the same.
short: Reduces ongoing costs and enables more deployments.

name: Expanded Cargo Holds
desc:
Increases maximum cargo capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.

name: High Resolution Sensors
desc: Increases sensor strength by %s points for frigates, destroyers, and cruisers, and by %s for capital ships.

name: Insulated Engine Assembly
desc:
Increases the durability of the ship's engines by %s, and the ship's hull integrity by %s.

The ship's sensor profile is also reduced by %s.
short: Makes engines harder to disable, lowers sensor profile.

name: Militarized Subsystems
desc:
Removes the penalties from a civilian-grade hull, and increases maximum burn level by %s.

Increases flux dissipation by %s, and adds %s armor for the damage reduction calculation only.

Increases minimum crew required by %s.
short: Removes sensor penalties, increases maximum burn level, improves combat performance, increases crew required.

name: Solar Shielding
desc:
Originally developed by Diktat engineers after spending cycles dealing with the unique conditions of the inner Askonia system. Decreases the effect operating in a solar corona has on combat readiness by %s; also has the same effect against storms in deep hyperspace.

In combat, reduces energy damage taken by %s.
short: Reduces effect of being in corona and energy damage taken.

name: Surveying Equipment
desc: Reduces the heavy machinery and supplies required to perform surveys by %s/%s/%s/%s depending on hull size, down to a minimum of %s for each.

name: Terminator Core
desc: Used by the terminator drone, this text should not be visible to the player.

name: Shared Flux Sink
desc: Handles %s of the flux dissipation of all attached modules. If modules are lost during battle, the extra flux dissipation is redistributed among the remaining modules. Up to %s of this extra dissipation applies to hard flux.
short: Flux/hard flux dissipation bonus as modules are lost.

name: Stealth Minefield
desc: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.
short: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.

name: Stealth Minefield
desc: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.
short: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.

name: Fighter Chassis Storage
desc: Fighter replacement rate does not go down when fighters are lost.
short: Fighter replacement rate does not go down.

name: Shield Always On
short: Forces shield to stay on. Hidden, doesn't need description or icon.

name: Missile Autoforge
desc: An autoforge inside the ship periodically fully reloads the magazines of all missile weapons.

name: Shielded Cargo Holds
desc: Commonly found on ships that can't always rely on shields to protect their cargo from cosmic radiation. Only a few tweaks are needed to have the shielding confound long-range cargo scans, reducing the probability of contraband being detected.
short: Improves chance to avoid detection of contraband.

name: Salvage Gantry
desc: Increases the resources gained from salvaging abandoned stations, derelicts, floating hulks, and other such by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Only affects the recovery of common resources such as fuel and supplies, and not rare items like blueprints. In addition, %s of the bonus applies to post-battle salvage.

name: Phase Field
desc: The ship is able to run a low-grade phase field for extended periods of time, reducing its effective sensor profile to zero.

name: Flux Shunt
desc: Allows the ship to dissipate hard flux at %s of the normal rate while shields are on.
short: Allows dissipation of hard flux while shields are up.

name: Civilian-grade Hull
desc: Increases sensor profile by %s. Reduces sensor strength by %s.
short: Increases sensor profile, reduces sensor strength.

name: High Maintenance
desc: Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s.

name: Monofilament Tow Cable
desc:
Improves the maximum burn level of the slowest ship in the fleet by 1. Multiple tugs can not be used to speed up the same ship by more than 1.

Can not be used in combat.
short: Increases burn level of another ship.

name: Drive Field Stabilizer
desc:
Stabilizes the fleet's drive bubble, increasing the maximum burn of the fleet by %s. The effect of multiple stabilizers is cumulative.

Increases the ship's sensor profile by %s.

name: Ground Support Package
desc: Close support weapons and counter-measures for ground defenses. Increases the effective strength of planetary raids by %s, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.

name: Advanced Ground Support
desc: Close support weapons and counter-measures for ground defenses. Increases the effective strength of planetary raids by %s, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.

name: Delicate Machinery
desc:
The ship systems require excessive maintenance and do not stand up well under the rigours of prolonged engagements.

Increases the rate of in-combat CR decay after peak performance time runs out by %s.
short: Increases CR decay rate after peak time runs out.

name: Heavy Ballistics Integration
desc: Reduces the ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons by %s.
short: Reduces ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons.

name: Automated Ship
desc: This ship is fully automated, and does not require - and can not take on - any human crew.
short: Does not require and can not support crew.

name: Advanced Targeting Core
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Precludes the installation of a Dedicated Targeting Core or an Integrated Targeting Unit.

name: Targeting Supercomputer
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Also increases target-leading accuracy and greatly increases in-combat sensor range.

name: Experimental Phase Coils
desc: Reduces phase cloak cooldown by %s.

name: High Volition Attractor
desc: An experimental modification allowing high-frequency motes to be warped in by the rift core on board the ship.

name: Converted Cargo Bay
desc: This ship's cargo hold has been converted to house a pair of fighter bays. The improvised manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.

name: Vast Bulk
desc: The main body of this structure is vast and is, for practical purposes, capable of absorbing any amount of damage from conventional weapons without being destroyed.

name: Axial Rotation
desc: This structure constantly rotates around its axis.

name: Anchor Rotation
desc: This structure rotates around its anchor attachment point. For station modules only.

name: Reduced Explosion
desc: Reduced explosion radius and damage.

name: Always Detaches
desc: Always detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

name: Never Detaches
desc: Never detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

name: No Weapon Flux
desc: Weapon fire costs no flux. Used on fighters for fine-grained control of effective shield hitpoints.

name: Do Not Fire Through
desc: Weapons on other modules of a station will avoid firing through this module, even though the shots would go over it and not hit.

name: Shard Spawner
desc: Spawns shard ships when ship is disabled/destroyed.

name: Do Not Back Off
desc: Sets DO_NOT_BACK_OFF AIFlag

name: Fourteenth Battlegroup
desc: This ship is a survivor of the original 14th Domain Battlegroup which founded the Hegemony. It is a prime specimen of the Domain Navy's "decisive battle" doctrine, particularly exhibited by a series of radical structural modifications (performed with pre-Collapse industrial methods) which allow the mounting of heavier armor plating by a flat increase of %s standard units, with only a %s reduction in speed and maneuverability. Exceptionally well-tuned energy systems increase flux throughput and capacity by %s over standard examples of this hull.

name: Militarized Hegemony Auxiliary
desc: This ship is - or was - on the Hegemony auxiliary list. Uparmour kits applied at Hegemony Naval yards resulting in no loss of performance for a %s/%s/%s/%s increase in armor strength, depending on hull size. Core power systems have been upgraded to military standards resulting in a %s improvement in overall handling, %s increase in flux capacity, a %s increase in flux dissipation, and an increase of maximum burn level by %s.

name: Compromised Armor
desc:
This ship's armor has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Armor rating reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Compromised Hull
desc:
This ship's hull has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Degraded Engines
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's engines are suffering from permanently degraded combat performance. 

Top speed and maneuverability in combat reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Degraded Drive Field
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's drive field is suffering from permanently degraded performance. 

Maximum burn level decreased by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Faulty Power Grid
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's power grid will never be capable of achieving peak performance.

Flux capacity reduced by %s. Flux dissipation rate reduced by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Phase Coil Instability
desc:
The phase coils on this ship are impossible to calibrate properly due to subtle flaws. Reduces the phase-time bonus by %s, reduces the peak performance time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Structural Damage
desc:
This ship's hull has likely taken extreme damage in the past, possibly to the point of breaking apart. Armor rating reduced by %s, hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Glitched Sensor Array
desc:
The ship's sensor array is damaged past any repair short of a complete hull overhaul. Weapon range in combat reduced by %s. Sensor strength reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Malfunctioning Comms
desc:
The comm system has suffered serious damage, making punching through battlefield jamming even more of a challenge. Fighter engagement range reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Defective Manufactory
desc:
The manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Damaged Flight Deck
desc:
The flight decks on this ship have taken major damage and seriously interfere with normal operation. Time to launch replacement fighters is increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Unreliable Subsystems
desc:
A widespread loss of redundant components reduces peak operating time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Compromised Storage
desc:
The storage capacity of this ship is significantly degraded. Crew, cargo, and fuel capacity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Increased Maintenance
desc:
Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s. Increases minimum crew required by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Increases maintenance cost and crew requirements.

name: Erratic Fuel Injector
desc:
Increases fuel use by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Faulty Automated Systems
desc:
Increases minimum crew required by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Damaged Weapon Mounts
desc:
Reduces weapon turn rate by %s and increases recoil by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Reduces weapon turn rate and increases recoil.

name: Degraded Life Support
desc:
Reduces maximum crew capacity by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Degraded Shields
desc:
Increases the amount of damage taken by shields by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Destroyed Weapon Mounts
desc: Some of the original weapon mounts on this ship have been damaged beyond repair and can no longer be used.

name: Ill-Advised Modifications
desc: This hull's systems have been drastically modified from spec, likely without certified engineering oversight. Its systems appear to work correctly under routine conditions, but have a significant chance of critical malfunction when stressed.
